title: England boss Gareth Southgate cannot promise dropped Wayne Rooney will return — and reveals Theo Walcott anger at snub
text:
Sport England boss Gareth Southgate cannot promise dropped Wayne Rooney will return — and reveals Theo Walcott anger at snub Skipper and record scorer might be FOURTH choice No10 now PLUS: Arsenal star annoyed by the bad news... on his birthday Share England will face Germany and Lithuania without Rooney (left) and Walcott (Photo: AFP/Getty/Action Images via Reuters) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Wayne Rooney has been ruthlessly axed by Gareth Southgate - with no guarantee of an England return. 
Despite a striker crisis, Southgate has decided to do without his captain and the nation's record goal-scorer, who is fit, for next week’s games against Germany and Lithuania. 
And he is considering scrapping the tradition of the Three Lions having a permanent skipper. 
Rooney, 31 , has only started once for Manchester United in the Premier League since mid-December and only scored two goals in three-and-a-half months. 
He has been replaced in the squad by Sunderland's 34-year-old Jermain Defoe, who won his last cap in 2013. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Southgate explains decision to include Defoe in squad Share this video Defoe reveals he ignored Southgate's text message before sensational England recall 
Southgate said: “We have to look at Wayne as a No10, which is his predominant role. 
"In the last two games we’ve played Dele Alli there, we’ve played Adam Lallana there. Both are playing very well, scoring and assisting for their clubs. Ross Barkley has been playing very well for his club. So there’s competition. 
"I can’t dress that up any other way. 
‘Wayne is not ruled out for the weekend [when United play Middlesbrough]. But there is also a need for others to step forward. We have this thing about ‘an England captain’, but really the captain is the person who is captain in the next game.” 
Southgate also revealed he was angrily challenged by Theo Walcott over his omission from the squad — which was announced on the Arsenal forward's 28th birthday. Walcott's 17 goals this season were not enough despite England's injuries up front (Photo: Reuters) Read More Southgate won't give players time off during international break after Rooney controversy 
Walcott has scored 17 goals in all competitions this season, but misses out even though Harry Kane and Daniel Sturridge are unavailable. 
“I’ve got to say he wasn’t chuffed to bits to get the call. And I understand that," said Southgate. 
“Quite rightly, he said, ‘I’m one of the leading goal-scorers in the league’. 
"I don’t mind being challenged on that at all. I totally respect that. I don’t expect him to be happy. But I’ve got to make decisions and I think it was the right think to call him to talk that through — even though the timing [his birthday] probably wasn’t great.” 
Southgate will no longer indulge players struggling with injuries or unable to make it into their club sides, despite keeping faith with Manchester United's little-used left-back Luke Shaw. 
He added: “The physical part of how we play is quite crucial. Rooney broke Bobby Charlton's England goals record — but has he now scored his last? (Photo: Getty) Read More 
“If I look towards longer-term tournaments, being physically able to play games in a short period of time is going to be a critical factor. 
“We want to press. I want a team with a lot of energy. 
"So if you are a bit short of match fitness with your club, to make that jump internationally is going to be a tough call because generally that [playing for England] takes more energy. The week can take more out of you. 
"If you’re not getting those minutes regularly for your club, it’s harder to hit that level.” SQUAD TO PLAY GERMANY AND LITHUANIA
